revised_title: A Case Study of a Periodical Haemorrhage and its Effects on Health
tldr: The author presents a case study of a man who experienced a periodical haemorrhage in his thumb, which ceased after 20 years and led to various health issues, including sputum sanguinis, colic, and a sallow, faint appearance. The case study challenges the notion that the menses in women are derived from a uterine ferment, as the man's discharge is similar to the menses but occurs in a different part of the body.
